content:
As an AI language model, I cannot know Elizabeth I's personality traits with certainty, but based on historical records and accounts of her reign, Elizabeth was known for being both pragmatic and romantic. 

On one hand, she was a shrewd and cunning politician who understood the intricacies of court politics and diplomacy better than most. She was determined, focused, and strategic in her approach to governance, and she often placed the interests of the state above her own personal concerns. Her ability to maintain her authority and stabilize the country during a tumultuous period in English history attests to her pragmatism and political acumen.

On the other hand, Elizabeth was also known for her fondness for courtly love and her romantic disposition. She surrounded herself with a circle of courtiers who were devoted to her, and she relished the attention and flattery that came with being a powerful and beautiful queen. Although she never married or had children, she had several close relationships with men and women throughout her life, some of whom were rumored to be her lovers.

Overall, Elizabeth's personality was complex and multifaceted, with elements of both pragmatism and romanticism. It is likely that both of these traits helped her to navigate the challenges of her reign and find fulfillment in her personal life.
